Key Match Events: The Utah Jazz edged past the Dallas Mavericks 115-113 to secure their first win at home.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dallas Mavericks inked Klay Thompson to a three-year deal with faith in his championship DNA and versatile two-way play that was instrumental in the Golden State Warriors' four championships with the player in their ranks.
Post-Match Reflections: Klay Thompson's 17 points weren't enough as the Utah Jazz edged past the Dallas Mavericks 115-113 to secure their first win at home.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Klay Thompson has looked effective for Mavericks in his maiden stint
Dallas are on a three-game losing streak and snapping the skid will be a priority as they take on the Spurs with homecourt advantage.
Others: Klay Thompson comes into the Jazz matchup averaging 14.5 points, 3.7 rebounds, 2.1 assists, 0.5 steals, and 0.2 blocks from 11 games. He's shooting 41.7% from the field and 37.2% from beyond the arc.
